content: उपतप् {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To make warm, heat; उपतप्तोदका नद्यः <ls>Rām.</ls>; <ls>Śi. 9. 65</ls> (where it means to pain also). {@--2@} To feel pain, become sick; आहिताग्निश्चेदुपतपेत् <ls>Āśval.</ls> {@--3@} To afflict, befall (as a sickness); sometimes used impersonally. {%--<ab>pass.</ab>%} {@--1@} To be pained, become ill, be afflicted with; इत्यपूर्वमुपतप्यतेऽस्माभिः <ls>Mv. 2</ls>; so दुःखेनोपतप्यते &c. {@--2@} To be emaciated with penance, practise penance; उपतप्यामहे तपः <ls>Av.</ls> {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} {@--1@} To kindle, ignite, burn. {@--2@} To torment, hurt, pain. {@--3@} To offend, oppress. {@--4@} To mortify the body by penance.
